reasoning: Eyelid ectropion (involutional) measured as prevalence, not incidence. Population-based studies show 2.9% prevalence in elderly (60+), increasing with age. Global estimate ~5% accounting for age-dependent prevalence distribution.
source: Cahill M et al. (2002). Involutional entropion and ectropion of the lower eyelid: prevalence and associated risk factors in the elderly population. Br J Ophthalmol. 86(8):891-894
